required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship Between Muscle Strength and Quality of Life in ICU Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Relationship Between Grip and Quadriceps Strength on Quality of Life in ICU Survivors

brief_summary.textblock: The aim is to study the impact of muscle strength measured in ICU and after ICU discharge on health-related quality of life measured after hospital discharge.

primary_outcome.description: assessed using the Sarcopenia Quality of Life (SARQOL) questionnaire short form: 8 questions with qualitative responses
assessed using the Sarcopenia Quality of Life (SARQOL) questionnaire short form: 8 questions with qualitative responses
assessed using the Sarcopenia Quality of Life (SARQOL) questionnaire short form: 8 questions with qualitative responses

assessed using the EuroQOL 5 dimensions (EQ-5D) questionnaire: a first part assess the 5 dimensions of health state (each dimension is scored from 1 to 3, 3 indicating extreme problems). A second part is visual analog scale ranging from 0 (the worst health you can imagine) to 100 (the best health you can imagine)

assessed using the EuroQOL 5 dimensions (EQ-5D) questionnaire: a first part assess the 5 dimensions of health state (each dimension is scored from 1 to 3, 3 indicating extreme problems). A second part is visual analog scale ranging from 0 (the worst health you can imagine) to 100 (the best health you can imagine)

assessed using the EuroQOL 5 dimensions (EQ-5D) questionnaire: a first part assess the 5 dimensions of health state (each dimension is scored from 1 to 3, 3 indicating extreme problems). A second part is visual analog scale ranging from 0 (the worst health you can imagine) to 100 (the best health you can imagine)

intervention.description: measure of handgrip strength using Jamar Dynamometer and a standardized protocol, strength expressed in kg
maximal isometric quadriceps strength measured using a handheld dynamometer and a standardized protocol, strength expressed in Newton

study_pop.textblock: the study includes patients in ICU after a stay of at least 7 days. They are included as soon as they are collaborative.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- critically ill patients with an ICU stay of at least 7 days
- collaborative
Exclusion Criteria:
- non collaborative, confusion, coma
- limb paresis or plegia
- patient refusal
